page.title: 03ARNPRIOR VILLAGES
page.content: Arnprior village has neither church nor pub and the local people have always travelled to Kippen or Buchlyvie for these facilities.But the people of Arnprior district feel they belong to neither of these communities,hence their powerful sense of communal identity focusses itself to a great extent on the school.The school perforce doubles up as village hall and meeting house,playing host weekly to the youth group and a thriving branch of the Women's Rural Institute.In winter it is used for occasional village ceilidhs and dances,for whist drives and sundry charitable fund raising activities and in the spring it houses the annual Bulb Show.Until recently it was used for a monthly evening service.
